ml.alternet.parser

Class Grammar.Rule

  • java.lang.Object
    • ml.alternet.parser.Grammar.Rule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable, Presentable, TraversableRule
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Grammar.Combine, Grammar.Token, Grammar.Wrapper
    Enclosing interface:
    Grammar

    public abstract static class Grammar.Rule
extends Object
implements Cloneable, Presentable, TraversableRule
    A grammar is composed of rules that can be tokens or so-called rules. When parsing, a rule yield a EventsHandler.RuleStart event and a EventsHandler.RuleEnd event.
    Author:
    Philippe Poulard
    See Also:
    Grammar.Token

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface ml.alternet.parser.visit.TraversableRule

        TraversableRule.CombinedRule, TraversableRule.SimpleRule, TraversableRule.StandaloneRule

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Parser parser
      The active part of the rule when it is applied on the input to parse.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public String getName()
        When a grammar declares a rule or token, it has a name which is the name of the field in that grammar, otherwise it is an anonymous rule or token.
        Returns:
        The proper name of the rule/token, or a name based on the class name.

      • setName

        public void setName(String name)
        Used internally to set the name of this rule.
        Parameters:
        name - The grammar field name.

      • isGrammarField

        public boolean isGrammarField()
        Description copied from interface: TraversableRule
        Indicates whether this rule is defined as a field in a grammar.
        Specified by:
        isGrammarField in interface TraversableRule
        Returns:
        true if this rule has a name false otherwise.

      • isFragment

        public boolean isFragment()
        Indicates whether this rule was annotated with Grammar.Fragment or not, and therefore have to be processed by its enclosed rule.
        Returns:
        true if this rule/token is a fragment, false otherwise.

      • setFragment

        public void setFragment(boolean isFragment)
        Used internally to set whether this rule is a fragment (annotated with Grammar.Fragment).
        Parameters:
        isFragment - true if this rule/token is a fragment, false otherwise.

      • toStringBuilder

        public StringBuilder toStringBuilder(StringBuilder buffer)
        Append to the given buffer a representation of the rule, that will be its name if it has one, or the pretty representation of this rule.
        Parameters:
        buffer - The buffer that receive the string representation.
        Returns:
        The same buffer, for chaining.

      • id

        public int id()
        Return the identifier of this rule, should be used for logically comparing 2 rules : rules may be cloned when extending a grammar, but they will share the same ID.
        Returns:
        The identifier of this rule.

      • or

        public Grammar.Rule or(Grammar.Rule... alt)
        Compose this rule with a choice of other rules.
        Parameters:
        alt - The alternate rules.
        Returns:
        A new rule composed of this rule followed by all the given rules.

        public <T extends Number> Grammar.TypedToken<T> asNumber(Class<T> numberClass)
        Make this rule a token number, the token value being of the type expected.
        Type Parameters:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • asToken

        public <T> Grammar.TypedToken<T> asToken(Function<LinkedList<EventsHandler.TokenValue<?>>,T> mapper)
        Make this rule a token.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the target data.
        Parameters:
        mapper - A function that computes the token value from the tokens matched by the rule.
        Returns:
        This rule as a token.

      • asToken

        public Grammar.TypedToken<String> asToken(BiFunction<String,Grammar.Rule,String> mapper)
        Make this rule a token.
        Parameters:
        mapper - A function that computes the token value from the token matched by the rule : (aValue, thisRule) -> newValue.
        Returns:
        This rule as a token.

      • drop

        public <T extends Grammar.Rule> T drop()
        Drop the tokens produced by this rule ; grammar fields are modified, and other rules will be wrapped.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the dropped rule.
        Returns:
        A drop element.
        See Also:
        Grammar.DropToken
